problems.question: Calculate the magnitude of the electric field made by a 2.00 C charge from 10.0 meters away.
problems.author: Doyoon Kim

problems.question: Positive charge A creates an electric field with magnitude of 8.64 N/C from 0.540 m away. Calculate the charge of A.
problems.author: Doyoon Kim

problems.question: How far away from a 3.00 C charge should you be, in order to feel 2.00 N/C of electric field?
problems.author: Doyoon Kim

problems.question: Consider the situation where the magnitude of the electric field at \((x, y, z)\) is equal to \(|34.7x - 34.8xy + 891z^3| \, N/C\). Calculate the magnitude of the force a 2.00 C charge would feel in (45.6 m, 11.0 m, -33.1 m).
problems.hint: Calculate the electric field’s magnitude in the given coordinates.
problems.author: Doyoon Kim

problems.question: Consider two +3.00 C charges on the x-axis. One is at (-3.00 m, 0), and the other at (3.00 m, 0). Calculate the electric field at (6.00 m, 0).
problems.hint: Add up the electric fields made by each of the charges.
problems.detailed: From (-3,0): \( E_1 = \tfrac{1}{4\pi \epsilon_0} \frac{3.00}{(9.00)^2} \), direction +x. From (3,0): \( E_2 = \frac{1}{4\pi \epsilon_0} \frac{3.00}{(3.00)^2} \), direction +x. Net field: sum in +x, \( 3.33 \times 10^9 \, \text{N/C} \).
problems.author: Doyoon Kim

problems.question: A +6.00 C charge is placed at (0.00 m, 5.00 m), and a -6.00 C charge is at (0.00 m, -5.00 m). Calculate the magnitude of the electric field at (26.0 m, 0.00 m).
problems.hint: Find x and y-components of the field from each charge.
problems.detailed: Angle: \( \tan \theta = 5/26 \Rightarrow \theta = 10.89^\circ \). Field magnitude from one charge: \( E = \frac{1}{4\pi \epsilon_0} \frac{6.00}{26^2+5^2} = 7.69 \times 10^7 \, \text{N/C} \). Components: +x: \( 7.55 \times 10^7 \), -y: \( 1.45 \times 10^7 \). From -6 C: -x: \( 7.55 \times 10^7 \), -y: \( 1.45 \times 10^7 \). Sum: \(0, -2.91 \times 10^7\). Magnitude = \( 2.91 \times 10^7 \, \text{N/C} \).
problems.author: Doyoon Kim

problems.question: A +1.00 C charge with mass 1.00 kg is inside a uniform field of 8.31 N/C. Initial velocity is 680 m/s perpendicular to the field. Find its speed after 35.0 s.
problems.hint: Velocity’s x-component is constant; y-component accelerates.
problems.author: Doyoon Kim
